pandaEditor.game.nodes.basemetaclass module¶

class pandaEditor.game.nodes.basemetaclass.BaseMetaClass(name, bases, attrs)[source]¶

Bases: type

classmethod get_mro(cls, mro)[source]¶
mro()[source]¶

Called every time class.mro() is called - NOT once during class creation. Don’t call mro() in your own code, use __mro__ instead.

pandaEditor.game.nodes.manager module¶

class pandaEditor.game.nodes.manager.Manager[source]¶

Bases: object

get_component_by_name(c_type)[source]¶
get_type_string(comp)[source]¶

Return the type of the component as a string. Components are identified in the following method (in order):

  • If the component has the class variable ‘cType’ then this string

will be used as the type. - Use the component’s type’s name as the type. - If this is ‘NodePath’ then look for a overriding tag on the node for the type. - If this tag is missing, use the NodePath’s node as the type.

get_wrapper(obj)[source]¶
wrap(obj)[source]¶

Return a wrapper suitable for the indicated object. If the correct wrapper cannot be found, return a NodePath wrapper for NodePaths and a Base wrapper for everything else.

pandaEditor.game.nodes.modelroot module¶

class pandaEditor.game.nodes.modelroot.ModelRoot(data)[source]¶

Bases: NodePath

add_child(child)[source]¶

Parent the indicated NodePath to the NodePath wrapped by this object. We don’t have to parent NodePaths with the model root tag as they were created with the correct hierarchy to begin with.
